* @param tasks TaskList, contains all our Task we create

* @param storage Storage, responsible for saving and loading of tasks into a text file
* @param parser Parser, helps to parse user inputs to perform subsequent actions
* @param input String, user input into the program
* @throws BernieException For invalid command by the user
* @throws InvalidArgumentException For a correct command with invalid arguments given by the user
public AddCommand(TaskList tasks, UiHandler uiHandler, Storage storage, Parser parser, String input)
throw new BernieException("Not a valid type of task!");
* Executes the AddCommand, calling the TaskList to add the respective task based on the Type
* determined by the parser. After adding, storage will save the updated tasks and uiHandler shows
* Command is the abstract class. Any subclass of Command is created in the CommandHandler
* for execution of the respective command. Command is executed to perform actions based on the
* input of the user into the program.
* @param tasks TaskList, contains all our Task we create
* @param uiHandler UiHandler, responsible for printing out messages to the user for any action done
* @param storage Storage, responsible for saving and loading of tasks into a text file
* @param parser Parser, helps to parse user inputs to perform subsequent actions
* @param input String, user input into the program
public Command(TaskList tasks, UiHandler uiHandler, Storage storage, Parser parser, String input) {
* CommandHandler determines which Command to execute given the user input. Parser helps to
* parse the user input to help CommandHandler determine the respective Command.
* Constructs the commandHandler to handle user inputs
* Commands are performed according to the input, done by creating the respective commands and
* executing it. Parser helps to determine the Type given the user input. uiHandler displays to
* the user the relevant message according to their input.
* Exceptions are caught and printed out for the user.
* @return boolean value, indicating if the program will end or not.
MarkCommand markCommand = new MarkCommand(tasks, uiHandler, storage, parser, input);
DeleteCommand deleteCommand = new DeleteCommand(tasks, uiHandler, storage, parser, input);
AddCommand addCommand = new AddCommand(tasks, uiHandler, storage, parser, input);
FindCommand findCommand = new FindCommand(tasks, uiHandler, storage, parser, input);
* Runs the CommandHandler. uIhandler greets the user and storage loads tasks if the program was run
* previously. CommandHandler continuously takes in the user input until the user ends the program.

* @throws InvalidArgumentException For a correct command with invalid arguments given by the user
public DeleteCommand(TaskList tasks, UiHandler uiHandler, Storage storage, Parser parser, String input)

* Through uiHandler, the tasksList is called to find tasks that match the user input parsed
* MarkCommand is responsible for getting TaskList to mark/unmark the respective task number provided
* Constructs a MarkCommand Class. The parsedArr is determined by the parser,
* giving out the relevant arguments required to execute mark/unmark.
* @param tasks TaskList, contains all our Task we create
* @param uiHandler UiHandler, responsible for printing out messages to the user for any action done
* @param storage Storage, responsible for saving and loading of tasks into a text file
* @param parser Parser, helps to parse user inputs to perform subsequent actions
* @param input String, user input into the program
* @throws InvalidArgumentException For a correct command with invalid arguments given by the user
public MarkCommand(TaskList tasks, UiHandler uiHandler, Storage storage, Parser parser, String input)
* Calls the TaskList to mark or unmark a task number depending on the parsedArr
* which is the parsed user input
* Different Type of tasks: notable types are EMPTY, when the user inputs nothing: "".
* LIST, BYE, EMPTY are inputs that won't result in creation of tasks.
* MARK, UNMARK, DELETE are action tasks that changes the state of the tasks.
* ADD: refers to when Type is to be added are: TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT.
* They are the 3 different types of tasks that can be created.
* BernieException is thrown when an invalid command is given
* InvalidArgumentException is thrown whenever the user enters invalid arguments into a valid command. Such examples
* are marking a task when it is already marked, or marking a task that doesn't exist, etc.
* Parser Class helps to parse the inputs given by the user.
* It has parseType method: a preliminary Parser to determine what type of input
* It also has getParams method which help to extract out relevant parts of the input
* and return parameters needed accordingly to perform actions
* Serves as the preliminary Parser to determine what
* type of input has the user keyed in. The possible inputs are:
* list, bye, mark, empty (the ""), delete, and a general add input
* which is determined in the program by inputs: todo, deadline, event
* Verifies the user input is of which task type
* @return boolean to affirm if the input is of this task
public boolean isType(Type taskType, String input) {
* Splits a user input into an array containing parameters for handling actions accordingly,
* @param input String, a user input to be split into an array of parameters
* For "todo": an array of 1, containing description.
* For "mark": an array of 2: [action, taskNum], action is either mark/unmark
public String[] getParams(Type taskType, String input) throws InvalidArgumentException {
* Checks if user marks a task that is already marked, or unmarks a task that is already unmarked
* @throws InvalidArgumentException if user attempts to marks a marked task or unmark an unmarked task
* Checks for valid "mark" or "delete" action inputs. Throws error if it is not valid: wrong input format or
* a task number is not given
* @param parsedArr String[], the user input String split into an array of String for processing
void checkMarkOrDeleteInput(String[] parsedArr, Type action) throws InvalidArgumentException {
throw new InvalidArgumentException("That's not a task number! Put a number.");
throw new InvalidArgumentException("Wrong input. Type this: mark/unmark taskNumber");
throw new InvalidArgumentException("Wrong input. Type this: delete taskNumber");

* Storage class handles the loading and saving of tasks in the file

return isDone ? String.format("[X] %s", description) : String.format("[ ] %s", description);
